channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A UN inquiry accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza, joining a rising chorus
item.description: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide...

item.title: For first time in decades, U.S. says Colombia is falling short in drug war
item.description: For the first time in decades, the U.S. has decertified Colombia as a drug control partner — a symbolic blow to one of Washington's closest allies in ...

item.title: JD Vance vows to carry on Kirk's legacy. And, the Fed meets to decide interest rates.
item.description: Vice President Vance hosted Charlie Kirk's podcast yesterday and vowed to carry on his friend's political legacy. And, the Federal Reserve meets to de...

item.title: Movie star and visionary Robert Redford has died at age 89
item.description: A movie star to his core, Robert Redford has died after a visionary career in cinema, including founding the Sundance Institute that transformed the m...

item.title: Trump files $15 billion defamation lawsuit against 'New York Times'
item.description: President Trump filed a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times and four of its journalists, accusing them of harming his business a...

item.title: Suspect in Charlie Kirk shooting likely to face charges Tuesday before first court hearing
item.description: Prosecutors are looking at filing a capital murder charge against the Utah man jailed in the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Israel has committed genocide in Gaza, UN commission of inquiry says
item.description: The panel finds that four of the five genocidal acts defined under international law have been carried out against Palestinians during the war.

item.title: Watch Live: FBI's Patel testifies at hearing in aftermath of Kirk assassination
item.description: FBI Director Kash Patel is appearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee on Tuesday for an annual hearing on oversight of the FBI.

item.title: Judge dismisses terrorism charges against Luigi Mangione
item.description: Judge Gregory Carro also ruled a second-degree murder charge against Mangione could stand during a hearing on Tuesday.

item.title: Remembering Robert Redford: Photos show Hollywood star in iconic films
item.description: Pictures show Robert Redford in classic films including "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid" and "Three Days of the Condor."

item.title: Acting legend Robert Redford dies aged 89
item.description: The acting star was famous for roles in The Sting and Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid.

item.title: Workers fired, placed on leave for Charlie Kirk comments after assassination
item.description: A range of companies and other organizations are sanctioning — and sometimes firing — workers over their public comments about Charlie Kirk. They may ...

item.title: Luigi Mangione's state terrorism charges dismissed, judge rules
item.description: Luigi Mangione appeared in court Tuesday in New York City, where his two state terrorism charges were thrown out.

item.title: Watch: The Sundance Kid's life in the spotlight
item.description: The BBC's David Sillito takes a look at the career of the Hollywood icon who has died aged 89.

item.title: Georgia Supreme Court declines to hear Fani Willis’ appeal of her removal from Trump election case
Kipyegon wins historic fourth world 1500m gold
item.description: Faith Kipyegon storms to a fourth world 1500m title and extends her streak of dominance with a fifth consecutive global gold in the event.

item.title: Target to expand next-day delivery to 35 more cities by end of October
item.description: The Minneapolis-based company says it will offer next-day delivery in 35 U.S. metro areas by the end of October.

item.title: Trump administration joins Republicans’ campaign to police speech in reaction to Kirk’s killing
